item.title: [Resolved] Flite question
item.dc:creator: tnt-touch
item.description:
I am using flite in my app.
1. How can I include only flite in my final app and not all of the framework?
2. What exactly do I have to mention in my e.g. About view about politepix and flite? do I have to e.g. have all the text of the licenses in a textview?

item.title: Reply To: Flite question
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

Check out the FAQ for these answers:/openears/support

I think it’s fine to use the text I mentioned in the FAQ as long as you link to the CMU license somewhere (either to a reprint of it on your site or on one of their sites). Conforming to the CMU license isn’t something I can speak definitively about since it isn’t my license but in my experience the goal isn’t to put long licenses into your apps but to make sure that app users can access the licenses. Thanks for paying attention to crediting and licensing!

item.title: Reply To: Flite question
item.dc:creator: tnt-touch
item.description: Thank you very much…I will have all the licenses in my web site and the text you have in license.txt I will have it in my About view. I think it will be correct for all of us!
